Detailed Description

A StyleShape describes the graphic reprensentation of a key.

A StyleShape is a StyleItem that is used to draw the keys of the keyboard. A StyleShape object has 4 renderers that can be used to draw the key depending on its state. The StyleItem renderer is used to draw the key in the released state. The active renderer is used to render the key that is focused. The pressed renderer is used to render keys in the pressed and locked state. Finally, the latched renderer can be used to render the keys in the latched state.

See also:
StyleItem

StyleShape::setColors ( QString  colors[],
enum StyleItem::style_colours  key_color 
)

sets the colors of the shape

Changes the colors used in the css to render the shape.

Parameters:
colors This is an array of colors that are used in the css of the renderer.
key_color Either STYLE_KEY_COLOR, STYLE_LATCHED_COLOR, STYLE_ACTIVATED_COLOR or STYLE_MOUSE_OVER_COLOR. Defines the color to use in the background of the key.
